formalMetadata.description: Application containing a textarea for entering and spell-checking a message.
formalMetadata.title: Avoiding mistakes and making it easy to correct them
formalMetadata.dc:creator: johannes.koch@fit.fraunhofer.de

recommendation.label: XHTML™ 1.0 The Extensible HyperText Markup Language (Second Edition)

purpose.p: The test case is intended to pass because an accessible method for spell-checking is presented.

userGuidance.p: Imagine you have a landlord whose name is Steven Cloud. His bank details have changed, so you have to inform your bank about this in order to transfer the rent to the right account. For the following task you will be shown an example for such a message that includes some typing errors. Please read the message without changing anything and press the button “Check spelling” at the end. At next correct the typing errors by following the proposed procedure. The goal of the task is to get your feedback on how correcting typing mistakes in contact forms with short text can be designed adequately.

questionText.p: Was the approach to correcting typing errors adequate?

optionOther.p: Please make suggestions on how correction of typing errors in a feedback form could be improved. Any comment is welcome!
